name: Category

properties1.name: name
properties1.description: (mandatory) is the unique name of the parameter.

properties2.name: label
properties2.description: (mandatory) (translatable) is the descriptive title of the field.

properties3.name: extension
properties3.description: (mandatory) is the name of the extension for which the categories will be retrieved. For example, to list content categories, use the value 'com_content'. You can add also target one view, use the value 'com_component.view'.

properties5.name: required
properties5.description: (optional) The field must be filled before submitting the form.

properties6.name: show_root
properties6.description: (optional) is whether a choice representing the root category will be shown. Remove completely if it is not to be shown.

properties7.name: default
properties7.description: (optional) is the default category ID number.

properties8.name: description
properties8.example: select one of the following categories
properties8.description: (optional) (translatable) is text that will be shown as a tooltip when the user moves the mouse over the drop-down box.

properties9.name: class
properties9.description: (optional) is a CSS class name for the HTML form field. If omitted this will default to 'inputbox'.

properties10.name: published
properties10.description: (optional) (1/0/2/-2) is whether the drop down will show only published (1), unpublished (0), archived (2) or trashed (-2) categories. It is possible to combine different publishing status by entering the list of the corresponding numbers separated by comma (e.g. "0,2,-2" will display only unpublished, archived and trashed categories in the drop-down).

properties11.name: multiple
properties11.description: (optional) is whether multiple items can be selected at the same time (true or false).

properties12.name: showon
properties12.description: (optional) show this field on the bases of the value in another field. https://joomla.stackexchange.com/a/17682/2166

description: The category form field type provides a drop down list of all published categories for a certain extension. If the parameter has a saved value this is selected when the page is first loaded. If not, the default value (if any) is selected.
